storyInfo: Horn finds herself in a tough battle at the communications base. Bagpipe shows up at the most critical moment, and the two fight Mandragora together.

attributes.content: Our forces have taken over every last part of County Hillock, save a few small pockets.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: The barracks didn't realize our true strength until it was too late, just as planned.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Did you see the looks on their faces? A force they thought to have been wiped out, and suddenly it reappeared. Like they were seeing actual ghosts.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Their greatest failure coming right as they were celebrating their victories. Not many Victorians left with any fight in them.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Grr. I almost forgot. My dear classmates are still struggling about in the outskirts.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Pitiful, pitiful. Their last ditch effort isn't going to change anything, and even if we don't so much as lift a finger, they've long been on their last legs, exhausted by the corruption of the military.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Mandragora's off looking for them. She's plenty enough to deal with the issue.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: All according to plan—all except one thing.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Loughshinny got away.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: You mean to say my servants have failed.
I'd be lying if I said I wasn't surprised. They may be fools, but they hardly claim the title of 'weak.'
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: That said, we have no need of them anymore.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Their ambitions grew all too quickly. They only knew to fan the flames of war for their own benefit, even plotting to use Loughshinny to carry out their plans right under your nose.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: In the end, off they went, engulfed by the flames of their own appetite. Saved us some trouble.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: What about you?
*Cough*... *cough*...
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Me?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: You know me. All I want... is to see the end.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: I asked you this when we first met—
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: If death is inevitable, and order will always collapse no matter how many times it is rebuilt, then how do those who walk this journey bear with these pointless decisions again and again?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: And you... you reached your hand out to me.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: You showed me that even perished souls can dance brilliantly in death.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Ever since, I've always wanted to see for myself just how this world looks beyond the flames.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Greedy, yet honest.
Hah... The biggest difference separating me and those fools is that I know when to lie.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: So, what will we do with Loughshinny?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: My sister... Who did she pick?
We don't know much about the ones who saved her, but they rescued a great deal of the city's residents.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: They seem like... a medical-something aid group?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: To tell the truth, I'm deathly curious. They don't seem to have much to do with any one country, so why stand up against us?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Hoh, that sounds interesting.
Should I bring along a few men to scope them out?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Your call, my cherished strategist.
Perhaps there will come a day when I take a good look at them myself.
Send word that the Victorian soldiers are our only targets. If anyone dares lay a hand on the civilians, they become an enemy of Dublinn.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Yes, ma'am.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: There are some civilians against us, though.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: We must first make them believe we're standing on their side, no?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: What the people need after such a traumatic event isn't harsher rule. It's all the help they can get.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Oh, yes. And you are not to harm the rescuers either—at least not within County Hillock, and not in view of the locals.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: The fire's burning plenty bright. It's about time to put it out before it consumes everything, and renders this all a pointless charade.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Soon, the wounds will heal, and the masses will remember who it was that made them so cruelly suffer, and who it was that pulled them back out of hell.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Dublinn warriors are not like the Victorians—
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: And this idea will forever be etched onto the city's heart after its rebirth, like a scar.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: What about the outsiders...? If we stop now, will they see it?
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Anyone who's wanted for a look has already seen it.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: That's all we need to do?
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Of course. What did you think was the point of all this?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: To make the Tarans' voices heard? Do you really believe that? Neither you nor I have an ounce of anything to do with Tara.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: To take over County Hillock? Only an arrogant clown would believe that. Victoria may stand on shaky, even precarious ground, but any of the dukes' armies could easily reduce a nomadic city to ashes.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: All we need to do is make sure the fire burns, so that all of Victoria will turn their eyes to it.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: And in the fire, some of them will have seen only profit, some will have made known their hatred, and yet some will have found faith. In a way, this is quite the happy ending, wouldn't you agree?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Let's go. We still have one last thing to take care of.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Once we finish with that, it'll be time for us to leave. The traitors who continue to about on the stage are far more despicable than any clown.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Before it's time for us to step into the limelight again, we should climb back into the graves that Victoria was kind enough to dig for us. Such is the spectre force—Wouldn't you agree, Hill?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: 'The entire city has fallen. Communication signal's lost. We can't reach any of the teams...'
'The enemy's charging the base. They've clearly got us vastly outgunned. We can't hold here much longer!'
'Report...'
'Calling HQ. Retreat immediately. I repeat, retrea—Aghhhhh!'
Colonel, we have to go, now!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: We can't hold here. They have us surrounded—
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Go...? Go where?
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Talk later! County Hillock's gone!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Gone? Shut your godforsaken flap!
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: As long as I'm here, this city will never be lost! County Hillock will forever belong to the Victorian Empire!
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: They won't show you any mercy, Colonel! They have no mercy for Victorians... Please, come with us!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Go.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Colonel—!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: What are you standing there for? Run! With your tail clutched between your legs and your head hung in shame! Don't you ever cross my sight again—unless you have a death wish!
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Right... Right, then, we're leaving.
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: P... Please, stay safe!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: ...Hah.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Stay safe? On the battlefield?
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: How contrary to the meaning of a soldier.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: —Where's my blade?
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Here you are, old friend... How long has it been since you've last seen gunsmoke, since we last alighted a high-speed battleship together?
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.text: The sound of turret fire and screaming grows ever closer, before falling into silence for a brief moment.
A silence quickly followed by densely packed footsteps—that all come to gather in front of the tightly shut door.

attributes.content: In the darkness, the colonel stands up from his chair and adjusts the collar of his uniform, before he steps toward the entrance.
He stands up straight, draws his standard-issue saber, and raises it at what lies outside.
The bright light of the blaze comes surging through.
'My saber and I hail from Victoria!'
Oboe, Cello and I have made it to the communications tower!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: How is it looking on your end?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Leader, I have explosives planted on platforms 1 through 7. Just waiting on the enemy now!
attributes.name: Oboe

attributes.content: Very well, let's start with Number 1—
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Good, the enemy is heading in that direction! Watch out over there.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Cello, climb up the tower!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Oboe, Numbers 2 and 3!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Oboe... I'm seeing more Casters approaching through the passageway. Be careful!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Watch the Casters' attack. I'm detecting a strong energy signal accumulating—
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Keep your distance from the enemy!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: No, fall back immediately! Oboe, take your people and leave the passageway!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: The enemy's Arts have too wide an effect area! They aren't even going to look for you. They'll wipe out all the platforms with one gigantic fireball!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Understood, Leader. Let's see who's faster.
attributes.name: Oboe

attributes.content: Oboe...!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Cello, Oboe bought us some time. Keep heading up!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Get the word out as soon as you find the control panel.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I'll stay here at the bottom to provide suppressive fire.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Five minutes. You have my word, not a single one of them will be making it up the tower in the next five minutes.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Shells, ready to fire—
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: How's it looking up there, Cello?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Still ten meters to go... Ugh...!
attributes.name: Cello

attributes.content: Are there hostiles up there?!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Crossbowmen...! Eight o'clock!
attributes.name: Cello

attributes.content: Hngh... There's too many of them!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: If I head up there, we won't be able to hold the bottom of the tower...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I can't get a lock on them... They're too far away for me to reach!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: This isn't the time to worry about... that!
attributes.name: Cello

attributes.content: Don't do it! You'll bleed out before you reach the control panel!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Find cover!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: We can't... drag this out! I know you're hurt too... Leader!
attributes.name: Cello

attributes.content: I'm fine... *cough*...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Don't give me that, Leader. It's been six minutes. How many hostiles are there on your end? Twenty? Thirty? More?
attributes.name: Cello

attributes.content: Don't even have the leisure to talk, right?
attributes.name: Cello

attributes.content: It's seven meters away. I'll—
attributes.name: Cello

attributes.content: What's going on...?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Ah... hah! Leader, I'm fine! Someone took out the crossbowmen!
attributes.name: Cello

attributes.content: What? Could that be...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Leader!!! Look who's arrived—
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Ah... haha... You little menace...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Hold on just a bit longer! Just a bit! I'll take down these fire breathers!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Cello, Bagpipe's drawing their attention. Hurry!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Leader... I got the control panel open! We're almost there... almost...
attributes.name: Cello

attributes.content: Ughh...!
attributes.name: Cello

attributes.content: Cello?!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Her... Her stones... Leader... Watch out...
attributes.name: Cello

attributes.content: What's going on?!!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: —Leader!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Bagpipe dives toward Horn, sending the two of them tumbling to the side.
A large stone column falls from the top of the communications tower, leaving a hole where Horn stood just moments ago.
Where'd this column come from...?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Ugh... A spectre force Caster?!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Is she one of yours?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: You killed Cello!!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Not a fan of people touching my things without permission.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: What do you mean, yours?! It was the spectre force that invaded County Hillock!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Hmn... hah! Not even going to say hi before you fire?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: That's your Victorian Army etiquette, is it?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: You...! Are you thick?! Don't you see you can't harm me? That you're wasting all your effort?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: The rubble...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: (No weaknesses, no matter the angle.)
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: (Before my lance shells even get anywhere close, she maneuvers the stones around her to block off the attack.)
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: (Is that her Arts?)
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: (Take a look at Cello's body.)
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: (Was it the stones that bored through Cello like that? Whatever did it's all gone too... So she can manipulate stones to defend herself, AND conjure them as weapons?)
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: (Not the best news.)
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: (Let's test her and see how far she can go. I'm sure we'll find an opening.)
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Hmph. Got me wondering now if this is some suicide attempt.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Thanks to my men, I'm thinking you don't have much ammo left. If you keep shelling like that, you'll have nothing left to fight with. Then you'll just have to sit and wait as your death comes.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: To think Harmonie kept telling me over and over how impressive you were.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: 'Oh, they're the true face of the Victorian Army...' Hah. Look at you. Helpless, nowhere to go. Is that all a Royal Guard Academy distinction has to give?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: The way I see it, you aren't much better than the barracks... I'll make short work of you!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: You hate the Victorian Army, don't you...?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Guess again.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: I don't hate soldiers. No matter whose orders you're taking, we're all poor little shits throwing our lives away in the mess of war.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: It's people like you I hate.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: You have a decent family background, and you think that gives you the right to trample us lot under your feet—
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: What could be better than watching you kneel before me?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Go, run her through—!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Still have the strength to block?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: You've got perseverance, Lupo. Much better than your fellow nobles who pissed themselves the moment they saw me.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: But you still can't work it out? You don't stand a chance!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Our forces have taken over County Hillock. Yours are dead or shackled.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Oh, and by the way, we've had eyes on you ever since you and your unit waltzed merry into Hillock. We've been watching your every move.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Hrgh... You have a spy in the barracks?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: You thought you failed because of rotten luck? Or you weren't trying hard enough, misjudged? That's why you missed the chance?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Wrong! Fate has never been on your side!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Because—Victoria's long abandoned you!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: You're more pitiful than all those poor sods dying ignorant on the field of war—you threw yourself into this bloodbath willingly! And now, you're just a sacrificial pawn for your country!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: You mean... It's not just one spy...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: The military's filled with your supporters... Even some of the top brass...?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: In that case... what is your leader after...?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Is it Victoria's... Crown...?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: What right do you... have?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Shut your mouth!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: How—DARE you doubt our leader's nobility, when you're just a lapdog of the Aslans?!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Hah, haha...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: What are you laughing at?!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Your hypocrisy.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: You grit your teeth, talking of arrogant aristocrats and moneyed men, but you worship your oh-so-noble 'Leader' all the same—
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: You can't make this stuff up, can you?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: And what... do you know?!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: The Leader... She's noble for more than just her blood! She... She's strong, and gentle...
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Hah, I get it. You want to buy time for yourself and milk information. Am I wrong?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: You think your tricks'll work on me?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: You think it's going to matter even if I let slip something I shouldn't?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Neither of you will make it to the top of this tower—
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: And anyone hearing me is dead or soon will be!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: You'll need to try harder—little Feline.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Grrr!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: You're pretty good, I'll give you that. Very precise control over your weapon. You're trying to adjust your firing angle to pick out any openings in my Arts.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Too bad—If you weren't so heavily injured and had more ammo, you might just have given me a few scratches.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: This is it, then. Discussion time's over—
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Now!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: What...? The column just... collapsed on me...
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Man alive, my arms are sore with all that back and forth!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: That Vouivre...!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: And I thought she was berserking like an idiot. I never realized I wasn't her target. It was the columns at the tower base...
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Dammit... Dammit! How did you know?!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Leader, the rubble around her's clear!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: We made the right guess. She's agile with those Arts of hers, but she can only do one thing at a time—
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Doesn't matter whether she's shiftin' the rubble to shield or usin' them as spikes, she's wide open while she's castin'!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: The column's shattered her shield! Seize the day! Charge!
attributes.name: Horn
